Controller Testing

  1. Connect controller to battery source and makes sure it powers on
  2. Turn controller off and make sure it does not turn itself back on - wait about five minutes
  3. Examine the cable harness for any damage. Apply heat shrink if necessary.
  4. Connect the controller to Faraday Utility and make sure the parameters are the latest

Updated Controller

  • RCB Version 2.2.4r
  • Selector Version 2.1
  • BAC Version 5792
  1. Update the the motor parameters to NCTE
  2. Connect the controller to the test fixture and test the following
    • Motor start
    • Motor acceleration
    • Selector functionality
    • Working headlight
    • Normal charging
  3. Assign the controller a condition - like new or refurbished

Selector Testing

  1. Connect the selector to the test fixture bike and the Faraday Utility
  2. 'Run System Info' and see if the selector returns a value
  3. If no selector is attempted, the selector is likely damaged but one should attempt to run the selector update
  4. If the selector returns a value, run the selector update
  5. Confirm the selector updated by running system info
  6. An updated selector you flash white, black, battery level when the bike is turned on
  7. If the display needs to be replaced follow the Selector rework procedure
  8. Assign the selecotor a condition: like new or refurbished

Battery Balance Testing

Overview
While long-term battery degradation requires testing at Faraday's HQ, we have included a utility to check general battery health. The Faraday battery is a 12S2P pack. When operating correctly the individual cells should be within 50mV of each other. Using the Faraday Utility and Battery Utility it is easy to check cell health.

Cell Balance Guide

Battery Capacity Testing

Overview
To check battery you will need to use the West Mountain Battery Analyser

Procedure

  1. Connect the battery to the West Mountain Amplfier and turn it on with a switch or controller
  2. Connect the the Amplifier to the laptop and open the West Mountain Utility
  3. Select the plus icon to create a new test and enter a test name: ticket_date (ex. 3462_11-20-18)

  1. Select the correct profile for the battery type - 300Wh vs 230Wh

  1. The battery should discharge within one our. A graph of the voltage over time will be displayed in red.

  1. At the end of the test the battery capacity will be displayed. Screenshot this and save it in your records.
